title: What does 'realness' actually mean? The surprising, heartbreaking history behind RuPaul’s Drag Race slang
text:
Throwing shade, exerting realness, drawling out a well-timed “yaaas”. These are things you may have heard, received in a text message or even used yourself. If you haven’t, chances of encounter are set to rocket with the arrival of RuPaul’s Drag Race UK on BBC Three this week. But few use this slang without knowing the charged, defiant and often tragic circumstances of where it came from: ball culture, and the “houses” of marginalised LGBTQ people who created it in 1980s New York.

RuPaul’s Drag Race – in which a dozen-or-so drag performers (all men) compete in exhibiting Charisma, Uniqueness, Nerve and Talent for a cash prize and guaranteed platform – is a polished and tweaked television manifestation...
description: Throwing shade, exerting realness, drawling out a well-timed “yaaas”.
